verbs.description: reinforce (third-person singular simple present reinforces, present participle reinforcing, simple past and past participle reinforced)

entries.meaning: (transitive) To strengthen, especially by addition or augmentation.
examples: He reinforced the handle with a metal rod and a bit of tape.
The right homework will reinforce and complement the lesson!

entries.meaning: (transitive) To encourage (a behavior or idea) through repeated stimulus.
examples: Advertising for fast food can reinforce unhealthy dietary tendencies.
